headline.main: NAVAL INTELLIGENCE.; Cruise of the Storeship Relief.

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States storeship Relief, JAMES H. STRONG, Lieutenant Commanding, sailed from New-York on the 23rd of March, bound to Aspinwall with stores for the Home and Pacific Squadrons. The crew consisted of 40 officers and men. She arrived at Aspinwall on the 15th of April, making 22 day's passage.

docs.snippet: From the London Athenaum. The British Museum, which, in addition to its other treasures, contains one of the largest Chinese libraies in Europe, has just sustained the loss of the Chinese scholar to whom the cataloguing of it was intrusted.

docs.snippet: Brooklyn Common Council. THE WATER-WORKS--UNMUZZLED DOGS--THE RECESS--DE BURG'S ESTABLISHMENT-ATLANTIC STREET RAILROAD. A regular meeting of this Board was held last evening, President KALBFLEISCH in the Chair.

docs.snippet: To the Editor of the New-York Times: While all the scientific and unscientific world are or will be variously exercised in relation to the actual or anticipated approach of yellow fever, and other malaria, will you allow me to contribute my mite,...

headline.main: Sanitary Regulations--Yellow Fever, Cholera--Hegs for Scavengers--Vaccination.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Times: While all the scientific and unscientific world are or will be variously exercised in relation to the actual or anticipated approach of yellow fever, and other malaria, will you allow me to contribute my mite, such as it is, to the common stock ? That I can but glance at the subject is evident from its extent, and the limited space and time at my command.

docs.snippet: The Board of Councilmen met on Monday, the President, C. H. HASWELL, Esq., in the chair. A resolution was adopted that the Harlem Gas Light Company be directed to lay mains in One Hundred and Twenty-third-street, from Eighth to Sixth avenues.

headline.main: NEW-YORK CITY.; Board of Councilmen Police Intelligence. " BLATTING" AT A POLICE CAPTAIN AND THE DIRE CONSEQUENCES--EXPENSE OF PUMMELING AN EX-COUN-- Commissioners of Health. CARRYING A SLUNG-SHOT. STEALING A WATCH SURRENDERED BY HIS BAIL. ALLEGED MURDERER ARRESTED. A STATEN ISLANDER IN NEW-YORK.,

docs.snippet: We have at last received some news, though brief and unsatisfactory, of the Atlantic Telegraph fleet, which left Plymouth in England on the 10th of June. The steam-tug Blue Jacket arrived at St. Johns, N. F., on Sunday, in twenty-eight days from...
docs.abstract: Vetoes grant of Lots to the Orphans' Home
docs.lead_paragraph: We have at last received some news, though brief and unsatisfactory, of the Atlantic Telegraph fleet, which left Plymouth in England on the 10th of June. The steam-tug Blue Jacket arrived at St. Johns, N. F., on Sunday, in twenty-eight days from Liverpool, and reports having seen in latitude 51 32' N. and longitude 32 W., a large double-deck frigate, with cog-wheels fore and aft, and a large paddle steamer-both English.

docs.snippet: The steam-tug Blue Jacket, just from Liverpool, in twenty-eight days' passage, reports having seen, on the 24th of June, a large and small steamer, both British, in lat. 51 32' north, ion. 32 west. They made signals, but the Blue Jacket had no code,...

headline.main: LATEST BY TELEGRAPH.; UNFAVORABLE WEATHER, Operations Not Commenced on the 24th of June. Tile Vessels Seen Near the Rendezvous in Mid-Ocean. NEWS OF THE TELEGRAPH FLEET.

docs.lead_paragraph: The steam-tug Blue Jacket, just from Liverpool, in twenty-eight days' passage, reports having seen, on the 24th of June, a large and small steamer, both British, in lat. 51 32' north, ion. 32 west. They made signals, but the Blue Jacket had no code, and could not understand them. That same evening, saw a large steamer bearing down upon the others, but could not make out whether they were English or American.

headline.main: Death of Laurens Hamilton of the Seventh Regiment-Arrival of the Remains.

docs.lead_paragraph: The body of young HAMILTON arrived here from Richmond yesterday morning at 6 o'clock, per steam. er Roanoke, in charge of a Committee composed of one member from each of the Companies of the Richmond Regiment. It was received by a few of the friends of deceased, and conveyed to Trinity Church, where the funeral will take place this after noon, with appropriate ceremonies.

docs.snippet: PUBLIC NUISANCES-.-Every man in the City appears to be better informed in relation to the nuisances which endanger the public welfare, than the officers whose special duty it is to abate them and remove them. All the reforms of abuses in the...
docs.lead_paragraph: PUBLIC NUISANCES-.-Every man in the City appears to be better informed in relation to the nuisances which endanger the public welfare, than the officers whose special duty it is to abate them and remove them. All the reforms of abuses in the administration of the affairs of the City originate among outsiders.
